item.comment: Played this 35 years ago when I was on holiday with my parents. We were in a holiday home in Cornwall and the house had Monopoly, Dominos and this. I played it with my Dad all week and I have never forgotten the gameplay but could never remember the name of the game. 35 years on and I have finally tracked down the game and it is now part of my collection! Wonderful. It is the '2001' version with the little UFO type pieces.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Agricola
item.comment: A good game - not quite sure what all the fuss is about though...

item.name: Arkham Horror: The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion (Revised Edition)
Betrayal at House on the Hill
item.comment:
Didn't 'click' for me. The components aren't great, the tiles are bland and thin, the miniatures are cheap and not all the same scale. The monsters are just tokens, really bland tokens.
Your friends will make or break the game.

item.name: Black Gold
item.comment:
Great game.
This kicks Monopoly into touch completely.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
Braggart
item.comment: Great fun with children, not so much with adults.

item.name: Break the Safe
item.comment: Brilliant little co-op game for kids and parents to play together.

item.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Game
item.comment: Great game, even better if you are a Buffy fan.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: Fun party game.

item.name: Camel Up
item.comment: Wonderful game - very hard to predict the outcome of races - best played with happy gamers and children.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: This game is just perfect. Love it !

item.name: Carcassonne Big Box
item.comment:
Carcassonne in a huge box of air. The expansions are good but the missing draw bags are a really stingy thing to have left out. Also the main game tiles have the numbers from one of the expansions printed on them, so even if you play just the base game there are visual references on the tiles for part of the game you aren't playing...not cool.
I'm rating the boxed set highly as it is a great game BUT those bags should have been included and a second set of tiles should've been in there too.

item.name: Cards Against Humanity
item.comment: Can be hilarious, can also be dire.

item.name: Cathedral
item.comment: A nice little game with brilliant chunky plastic pieces. 1986 Mattel edition.

item.name: Chaos in the Old World
item.comment: If I shipwreck somewhere I will be holding this game in an airtight bag.

item.name: Chaos in the Old World: The Horned Rat Expansion
item.comment: Essential.

item.name: Chaos Marauders
item.comment: Much better than the reprint, the art on the original cards is superior in every way.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment:
Great game for novices and veterans alike.
*Cards sleeved.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.comment:
A superb game.
Have modded the miniatures and inked them.

item.name: Cthulhu Gloom
item.comment: I liked Gloom but I bought this version for the theme.

item.name: Cube Quest
item.comment:
After having the mats replaced the game has become one of my favourites to play. The flat surface, as opposed to the creased one I was originally playing with, has made a BIG difference to the gameplay.
Originally a 2/10
now a great 7.5/10

item.name: Cul-de-Sac
item.comment: Fairly good game, short and sweet.

item.name: Curse of the Idol
item.comment: Roll and move drivel BUT with the most redeeming theme.

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: A tremendously enjoyable game, balanced with great tactical choices. A firm favourite.

item.name: Cyclades: Hades
item.comment:
Excellent.
I have to strongly disagree with the Shut up and Sit Down review.
Hades makes Cyclades a fantastic game.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
item.comment:
Stunning game. I didn't experience the first edition but this version is very good indeed.
Currently painting the miniatures.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Labyrinth of Ruin
Disney Pixar Cars 2 Sorry Sliders: World Grand Prix Race Edition
item.comment: A good game with lovely playing pieces. I'd pick up two boxes if you can find some.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment: I want to like it more but it will never be a classic for me. However, I do enjoy watching how other people's minds work. I tend to run out of ideas...

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: What can you say about Dominion that hasn't been said already? It smells of cheese?! Perhaps not, but it is one of my favourite things of all time, nearly as good as cheese!

item.name: Dominion: Black Market Promo Card
item.comment: Great!

item.name: Dominion: Envoy Promo Card
item.comment: Great!

item.name: Dominion: Governor Promo Card
item.comment: Great!

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: Great!

item.name: Dominion: Stash Promo Card
item.comment: Great!

item.name: Dominion: Walled Village Promo Card
item.comment: Great!

item.name: The Downfall of Pompeii
item.comment: A nice little family game. I'm not sure if there is a winning strategy though.

item.name: Dracula
item.comment: Exciting to play. Great components with a nice quality board. Wonderful overall package. Tight rules with no real question marks hanging over them. A must buy if you like deduction, bluffing and/or gothic horror.

item.name: Dreadfleet
item.comment: Plastic Fantastic! I will play this when and only when I paint those GORGEOUS ships.

item.name: Dungeon Command: Drow Wizard Promo
item.comment: Was hoping to use this with Castle Ravenloft BUT it only comes with the Dungeon Command card so it is useless for this purpose.

item.name: Dungeon Roll
item.comment: *arrived on 2/9/2013

item.name: Dungeon Roll: Winter Heroes Pack
item.comment: Finally arrived. Lost all interest in the game now so won't be using this.

item.name: Dungeon!
item.comment:
Delightful to look at. The placing of monsters off the board on a grid is odd. The board should have been bigger so you could have the cards in the Dungeon.
A lovely introduction to fantasy board games for families with young children.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment:
Brilliant ! I love this game, I can even get my partner (who is indifferent to swords and sorcery / fantasy themes) to play this with me!
There isn't anything worth criticising about the game.
So many things to love.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game – Bonus Adventures
item.comment: Excellent addition.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game – Contest Adventures
item.comment: Excellent addition.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Conquest of Nerath Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
item.comment:
Brilliant ! I love this game, I can even get my partner (who is indifferent to swords and sorcery / fantasy themes) to play this with me!
There isn't anything worth criticising about the game.
So many things to love.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
item.comment:
Brilliant ! I love this game, I can even get my partner (who is indifferent to swords and sorcery / fantasy themes) to play this with me!
There isn't anything worth criticising about the game.
So many things to love.

item.name: Eaten By Zombies!: We Have the Bomb! Promo
Elder Sign
item.comment: Wonderful game. This one got me back into board gaming again. I had about 25 board games until I bought this, 6 months later I had over 100. Damn you Elder Signs, I love you.

item.name: Escape from Atlantis
item.comment: Great with the right group.

item.name: Escape from Atlantis
item.comment: Great with the right group.

item.name: Escape from Frankenstein
item.comment: An extremely light children's game. Fun for a Halloween night.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: This is a great game. Just a whole lot of fun.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Pit
item.comment: A good addition to get hold of.

item.name: Forbidden Bridge
item.comment: Great game. Rebuilt from various parts. 99% complete with only 2 red jewels missing.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: Fantastic co-op game.

item.name: Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game
Fury of Dracula (second edition)
item.comment:
Added a screen and wooden counters for hidden movement.
This game is superb.
Miniatures painted.

item.name: Game of Dracula
item.comment: A great game to play with children.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
Geister, Geister, Schatzsuchmeister!
item.comment: Wow ! I love this game so much. I am not sure why it appeals to me so much but the artwork, pace and top notch components help. Our copy came with great quality printed dice, so the 2nd print run got rid of the crappy stickered ones.

item.name: Ghost Castle
item.comment:
Glowing component!
One to play with the kids at Halloween, and then hide it again for another 12 months.

item.name: Ghost Stories
item.comment: I have to be in the mood to play this as it hurts my brain terribly. What a game it is though!

item.name: Ghost Stories: Chuck No-Rice
item.comment: Thanks Repos !

item.name: Ghost Stories: White Moon
item.comment:
Excellent expansion. However - production values are not as good as the base game. My 2013 reprint has low quality cards which are easy to bend and crease, they are also noticeably larger than the base game cards.
*Repos replaced the cards from the Ghost Stories base game with new cards to match the reprint of White Moon - unfortunately the cards are the same low quality as the White Moon cards and are still not the same size...

item.name: Glenn Drover's Empires: Age of Discovery – Plague Promo
Harry Potter: Adventure Through Hogwarts Castle 3D Game
item.comment: Amazing production values, maybe this game could be rescued with some house rule tweaking as it isn't particularly interesting to play.

item.name: Heckmeck am Bratwurmeck
item.comment: Just OK.

item.name: I Vant To Bite Your Finger
item.comment: The teeth on my Dracula don't leave red ink marks anymore as they have dried out.

item.name: Jamaica
item.comment: This is a great game. Pirates, racing, combat, resource management...it has it all.

item.name: Jamaica: Extraschätze
item.comment: A great addition to the game, track them down!

item.name: Jungle Speed
item.comment: Mad as a box of frogs!

item.name: Jungle Speed: The Extreme Expansion
item.comment: Even more mad if that is possible?!

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: A modern classic.

item.name: King of Tokyo: Power Up!
item.comment: Always included in the base game now.

item.name: Kingdom Builder
item.comment: Outstanding! I'm glad I didn't listen to the naysayers.

item.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
Letters from Whitechapel
item.comment: Superb.

item.name: Little Duckling (fan expansion for Space Alert)
Loopin' Louie
item.comment: Laughs and giggles, especially when alcohol is involved.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings Labyrinth
Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment: What a wonderful game! Everyone likes this game and gets it quickly, the mandatory quests you can play on each other make the game quite exciting.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Rapid Expansion Promo Card
Lords of Waterdeep: Rapid Expansion Promo Card
Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
Lost Temple
item.comment: Similar to Citadels, game mechanics wise, but there is room to own both games in my opinion.

item.name: Lost Temple: The Mandarin
item.comment: Not essential.

item.name: Lost Valley of the Dinosaurs
item.comment: I am hugely biased with my 9 here. It isn't worth a 9 but if YOU dare say that to me I will set my Pteradon on you and drop you in a swamp!

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment: It's a wonderfully simple and enjoyable game.

item.name: Love Letter: Kanai Factory Limited Edition
item.comment: It's a wonderfully simple and enjoyable game.

item.name: MacGregor
item.comment: Glowing components!

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game
item.comment: Expensive, complex, Vladaa.

item.name: Mage Wars
item.comment: This is a fantastic game, the components are top notch, the art is beautiful and the games are tactical and fun. I can see myself getting into this game in a big way.

item.name: Mansions of Madness
item.comment: Complex setup and time consuming too. Once setup this game is particularly good fun, especially with the right game environment. Played in the cellar with some family with candles for mood. Frighteningly good fun!

item.name: Mansions of Madness: Call of the Wild
Martian Dice
item.comment: Loveable game - just love those custom dice. Can drag on a bit - maybe only play to 20 points?

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment: Wonderful game. I really didn't think I'd like a WWII themed game but I was very, very wrong. M44 has made me look at other games I'd overlooked too, like Battles of Westeros and Tide of Iron. I will always have a soft spot for M44!

item.name: Mice and Mystics
item.comment:
Beautiful components, The game is unique in theme and is fun to play, I am hoping for expansions that are reasonably priced.
Miniatures painted.

item.name: Mice and Mystics Lost Chapter: Cat's Cradle
item.comment: Excellent addition.

item.name: Mice and Mystics Lost Chapter: The Ghost of Castle Andon
item.comment: Excellent addition.

item.name: Mice and Mystics: Tattered Threads of Reason
Midnight Party
item.comment: Sweet natured game - just about enough of a game here to play with adults. Perfect for families.

item.name: Nacht der Magier
item.comment: Glowing components! I love this game, it is unique.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment:
A modern classic! So many choices, so many tactics. The dice make the game a thrill and the cards are a genius method of getting stragglers back into the fray. Wonderful. (Using a UV black light is a nice novelty to use when playing this wonderful title.
The FFG reprint isn't as nice as the Avalon Hill version in my opinion. Seek this version out if you can.)

item.name: Der Palast von Alhambra
item.comment: A great game. Very enjoyable with two players.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: A wonderful game. (I prefer Forbidden Island for the tension) though. It can end with no real fanfare. This new edition has cheaper components, which is a real shame. The card stock is thinner, the cards are smaller and the parts are plastic. The board is also really busy and a stupid colour so it makes it hard to track the black infection cubes (which are transparent).

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: A wonderful game. (I prefer Forbidden Island for the tension) though. It can end with no real fanfare.

item.name: Panic Station: Parasite Control
item.comment:
A promo with no rules...
Thank goodness for BGG.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment:
So... I like this game a great deal BUT the publisher are having a laugh with their customer service. The 2nd edition has a tonne of errata and yet they want us (the customer) to pay for replacement cards.
Not a very nice way to treat your customer.
I would have given the game a higher score and bought the expansions, I won't now due to horrible business practices.

item.name: Pirate Fluxx
item.comment: My joint favourite Fluxx title, tied with Star Fluxx.

item.name: Pirate Fluxx: Skullduggery Promo Card
item.comment: Promo card. A good addition.

item.name: Polarity
item.comment: Chaotic!

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: For me personally, this game is dull as dishwater. I thought a game was supposed to have at least some element of fun? Nope. No amount of persuasion will ever result in me playing this game with anyone, not even strip Power Grid with Claudia Schiffer...although...no, not even then. Having said that I was introduced to this by a board game club who thought a 40 second explanation of the rules and then playing the game in total silence was a great way to introduce a potential new member to a game... Also the game was handed to a lesser player because another player thought it'd be fun to king make. Needless to say I haven't been back.

item.name: Quack-Shot
item.comment: This one seems to be totally ignored by BGG. Weird, as it is a total blast to play a few silly rounds.

item.name: Quarriors!
item.comment:
Simple to play, short play time and good quality components.
Quarriors kept in expansion box.

item.name: Quarriors! Quarmageddon
item.comment: Wonderful box - I can fit Quarriors and Rise of the Demons inside with room for much more.

item.name: Quarriors! Quaxos Promo Cards
item.comment: More Quarriors is good Quarriors.

item.name: Rampage
item.comment: Not many games as zany as this one on the market. Fun.

item.name: The Resistance: Avalon
item.comment: Just brilliant.

item.name: Rex: Final Days of an Empire
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment: I love this game - I will probably buy all the expansions.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Ambuscade Villain Character
item.comment: Brilliant !

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Infernal Relics
item.comment: Brilliant !

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Miss Information Villain Character
item.comment: Brilliant !

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Rook City
item.comment: Brilliant !

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Silver Gulch, 1883 Environment
item.comment: Brilliant !

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Final Wasteland Environment
item.comment: Brilliant !

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Scholar Hero Character
item.comment: Brilliant !

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Unity Hero Character
item.comment: Brilliant !

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: WOW, WOW, WOW ! This game is just fantastic. Buy it.

item.name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective
item.comment:
Sitting in chair next to warm fireplace? Check! Earl Grey tea? Check! Lights on low? Check! Magnifying glass? Check! Opiates? Optional...
WOW! what an immersive game this is, especially if you play with people who have artistic flair. Anyone who can muster up energy to do great voices for the multiple characters is going to lift this game into orbit.
If you are a bonafide Sir Arthur Conan Doyle fan this will already be on your gaming shelf.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Space Alert
item.comment: This game is great, especially with the Star Trek mp3s available for download here on BGG.

item.name: Space Hulk (third edition)
item.comment: Tense !

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
item.comment:
A hard game to wrap your head around at first, I had to use a video tutorial or 4... When you understand it it is very enjoyable indeed.
*Cards sleeved.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game – Mission Pack 1
item.comment:
Brilliant!
*Cards sleeved.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game: Space Marine Pack 1
item.comment:
Brilliant!
*Cards sleeved.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game: Tyranid Enemy Pack
item.comment:
Brilliant!
*Cards sleeved.

item.name: Space Pirates
item.comment: Ridiculously underrated. What an amazing mash up of ideas, you can pick this up for next to nothing and I think it will become highly sought after one day.

item.name: Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery
Spartacus: The Serpents and the Wolf Expansion Set
Star Fluxx: Android Doctor Promo Card
item.comment: Promo card. A good addition.

item.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation
Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation – The Next Phase
Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Original Series
item.comment: Wonderful game with wonderful production values. What the hell were they thinking with the size of the box though?

item.name: Star Trek: Catan
item.comment:
I LOVE the theme, just love it. It is still Catan and that is no bad thing.
Appalling rule book.

item.name: Star Trek: Fleet Captains
item.comment: Hugely enjoyable, but the rules are confusing. The game is expensive but you get a nice amount of ships.

item.name: Star Trek: Fleet Captains – Romulan Empire
item.comment: 3 player games take ages. The expansion is a solid addition to the game, those empty space tiles are a very bad joke though...

item.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – Interactive Video Board Game – A Klingon Challenge
item.originalname: Star Trek: The Next Generation – Interactive VCR Board Game – A Klingon Challenge

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing
item.comment:
Fantastic game.
4 x Core sets = 8 x Tie Fighters 4 x X-Wing Fighters

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – A-Wing Expansion Pack
item.comment: 1 x

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – B-Wing Expansion Pack
item.comment: 1 x

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack
item.comment: 1 x

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Slave I Expansion Pack
item.comment: 1 x

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Advanced Expansion Pack
item.comment: 1 x

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Bomber Expansion Pack
item.comment: 1 x

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Interceptor Expansion Pack
item.comment: 1 x

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Y-Wing Expansion Pack
item.comment: 1 x

item.name: Sumo Ham Slam
item.comment: Totally and utterly bonkers! (Which is good).

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
item.comment: I really enjoy this game but you need to play it with the right people. Cutthroat b**tards will love this.

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! 5-6 Player Mini Expansion
item.comment: Essential. (Unless you only know 3 people).

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! Dolphins & Dive Dice Mini Extension
item.comment: FAR too expensive for what it is. 2 dice and 4 wooden pieces for £9 !!!! The expansion is OK.

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! The Giant Squid Mini Expansion
item.comment: Far too expensive. Not essential.

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment:
A fantastic experience for anyone to enjoy. There are plenty of variants (official or unofficial) to add more challenge or more 'game'.
Don't listen to the 'naysayers' what do they know ?

item.name: Talisman (fourth edition): The Blood Moon Expansion
item.comment: Always included in the base game.

item.name: Talisman (fourth edition): The Frostmarch Expansion
item.comment: Always included in the base game.

item.name: Talisman (fourth edition): The Reaper Expansion
item.comment: Always included in the base game.

item.name: Talisman (fourth edition): The Sacred Pool Expansion
item.comment: Always included in the base game.

item.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition)
item.comment: I enjoy the stories this game can generate but I never feel in control of my character, which is ok.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: I will play this with family and non-gamers but I won't actively seek out a game any longer. Maybe I will come back to it one day...

item.name: Ticket to Ride: The Dice Expansion
item.comment: I prefer using the cards, but at least you can mix up the old formula a bit now.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: USA 1910
item.comment: Essential, although I found the original Ticket cards easier to find the cities!

item.name: Tide of Iron
item.comment:
Awesome ! I don't understand why Memoir '44 is always compared to this game, they are not really alike. I used to have both in my collection, I now only own this.
A great game.

item.name: Tide of Iron: Days of the Fox
item.comment: More awesome !

item.name: Tide of Iron: Designer Series Vol. 1
item.comment: Great stuff. The book is a hard cover and is nestled in the Tide of Iron box.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment: Epic game ! Bloody complex though.

item.name: Uncharted: The Board Game
item.comment: Overlooked and underrated game. Fantastic game with a good theme.

item.name: War of the Ring: Lords of Middle-earth – Treebeard Mini-Expansion
Wasabi!
item.comment: Delicious looking game.

item.name: Witch of Salem
item.comment: I REALLY like this game. I didn't buy this game for quite a while due to all the lacklustre reviews. Now I wish I had bought it ages ago. The game is deliciously difficult and the artwork is sublime. Wonderful game.

item.name: Wiz-War (eighth edition)
item.comment:
Wonderful game.
Miniatures painted. Cards sleeved.

item.name: Wrath of Ashardalon Bonus Adventures: Servants of the Thunder Shaman
Zombie Dice
item.comment: Always fun. I have yet to actually ever get a brain score as I am always after 13 brains in one go. Therefore I am useless at this game.

item.name: Zombie Dice 2: Double Feature
item.comment: Good, but not an essential purchase though.

item.name: Zombies!!! Roll Them Bones!
item.comment:
STOP!
Buy yourself a pizza instead.
The stained and greasy cardboard that housed your delicious pizza was put to much better use than the cardboard used to make this awful 'game'.
(The guy that rated this game a 10 has obviously had his brain eaten...maybe a real zombie was inside his copy?)

item.name: Zooloretto: The Dice Game
item.comment: Utterly brilliant game.
